text: Anand Mohan Zutshi Gulzar Dehlavi (Urdu: ; ) (7 July 1926 - 12 June 2020) was an Indian poet, scholar, and journalist. He was honored by Vice President Mohammad Hamid Ansari on his 91st birthday for his works towards Urdu Poetry. He was an editor of the first Urdu science magazine named Science Ki Dunya. He was born in New Delhi. He taught at the University of Delhi for forty years. Gulzar Dehlvi died on 12 June 2020 in New Delhi from problems caused by COVID-19, aged 93.Urdu poet Gulzar Dehlvi dies days after recovering from COVID-19 ==References== Category:1926 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in New Delhi Category:Indian journalists Category:20th-century Indian poets Category:Indian educators Category:People from New Delhi
